firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure prioritizes authorization independence and simplifies security rules. User data is stored in a private collection (`/users/{userId}`) ensuring only the user can access their information, while conversions are stored in a subcollection (`/users/{userId}/conversions/{conversionId}`). This hierarchical structure inherently secures the conversion data to the respective user. The structure uses path-based ownership for User data and their Conversions. To support the 'Admin Panel' requirement, a separate collection `/roles_admin/{userId}` stores admin roles, checking for the existence of a document instead of its content, enhancing security and simplicity. The structure segregation and path-based ownership ensures list operations are secure by default (QAPs) and access control is straightforward, enhancing debuggability. Crucially, this design avoids any `get()` calls in security rules, ensuring authorization independence and atomicity of operations.
